column4: EMERGING MARKETS-Brazil real eases as cenbank acts to slow rally
column5: By Bruno Federowski     SAO PAULO  March 21 The Brazilian real weakened on Monday after the central bank acted to weaken the rallying currency for the first time in three years.     The central bank announced late last week that on Monday  it would sell as much as $1 billion in reverse currency swaps  are instruments through which the central bank can weaken the real.
